lead_paragraph: Cuba, a police state working out how much to open up to the world and to its own people, has gone above and beyond to prevent embarrassing surprises.

byline.contributor: Frances Robles and Hannah Berkeley Cohen contributed reporting.
byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS

headline.print_headline: As Obama Arrives, Cuba Tightens Grip on Dissent
headline.main: As Obama Arrives, Cuba Tightens Grip on Dissent

snippet: Cuba, a police state working out how much to open up to the world and to its own people, has gone above and beyond to prevent embarrassing surprises.
abstract: Core challenges of resuming ties with Cuba are evident as government, in hours prior to Pres Obama's visit and meeting with Cuban Pres Raul Castro, detains Cuban dissidents; Obama plans to meet with dissidents during his visit, but most communications and events are still under strict Cuban government control.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
